I’m pretty sure that adding a while loop will cause a ton of lag. Try using a cycle event to apply the ring’s effects.

item.title: Adding 5 health points very 3 seconds
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

if (c.wearID == 15001 && c.inFunPk()) {
    long healTimer = System.currentTimeMillis();
    long lastRegen = 0;
    while (HP < 150) {
        if (healTimer - lastRegen > 3000) {
            c.playerLevel[3] += 5;
        } else {
             return;
        }
    }
    if (HP > 150) {
        HP = 150;
    }
    c.getPA().refreshSkills(3);
}

Read full topic

item.description:
@Lordabyssal wrote:

Alright. c.HPregen is the timer in which the health is added. I want it so It would add 5 hp very 3 seconds. I also want it to start the loop if the players hp level is below 150.

Im going to change HPregen to HPtimer.

item.title: Adding 5 health points very 3 seconds
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

if (c.wearID == 15001 && c.inFunPk()) {
    while (HP <= 99) {
         c.HPRegen += 5;
    } 
    if (HP > 150) {
       HP = 150;
    }
    c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
}

item.title: Adding 5 health points very 3 seconds
item.dc:creator: @Lordabyssal Lordabyssal
item.description:
@Lordabyssal wrote:

When you were the HP regen ring I made I want it so that it will give 5 hp until your hp lvl hits 150+. But i don’t now how i would go about creating a loop that will check if it is lower then 150 then start loop again. starts at 99 hp when wearing the ring it goes to 104 hp and on tell 150 then stops but if it goes down again to 110 then start adding again. Can anyone help me? thank you

if(c.wearId == 15001 && c.inFunPk()) { if ( HP >= 150 ) { return false;} for ( c.HPregen = 3; c.HPregen--; ) { c.HPregen = 3; c.playerLevel[3] += 5; c.getPA().refreshSkill(3); c.sendMessage("Working! OMG Working!"); } }

I have this at the moment.

Read full topic
